element.title: Tabview
element.desc: Provides a Redmond tab and controls the visibility of the content within it.
element.longdescription:
Note: Redmond components are deprecated. Please consider using LZ Components. If you use this component, you must explicitly include the redmond library:
<include href="redmond"/>

Description:
The tabview tag provides a standard Redmond tab and controls the visibility of the content within it. Tabview tags must reside under a tabpanelview tag. A tabview creates a tab and adjusts the width of it to enclose its label. The contents for the tabview will have a beveled gray background provided by its parent, tabpanelview. Also, the origin of the coordinate system for tab contents starts just below the tabs.

Example:

 <canvas>
   <include href="redmond/redmondtab.lzx" />

   <tabpanelview height="300" y="20" oninit="this.setSelected(tab1)" >
        <tabview name="tab1" label="Tab One" >
            <text x="10" y="10" > Content for Tab One </text>
        </tabview>  
        <tabview name="tab2" label="Tab Two" >
            <text x="20" y="20" > Content for Tab Two </text>
        </tabview>  
        <tabview label="Tab Three" >
             <text x="30" y="30" > Content for Tab Three </text>
        </tabview>  
       <tabview label="Tab Four" >
             <text x="40" y="40" > Content for Tab Four </text>
        </tabview>  
    </tabpanelview>

</canvas>

See also:
tabpanelview
